devdoc.details: TetuVaultAssetManager can invest funds to the TETU vault. Rewards will be claimed and distributed by governance

params.amount: - the amount of tokens to withdraw back to the pool
params.pId: - the poolId of the pool to withdraw funds back to

claimRewards().details: Claim all rewards and send to rewardCollector

initialize(bytes32).details: Should be called in same transaction as deployment through a factory contract

maxInvestableBalance(bytes32).details: returns amount of tokens which will be invested or devested during rebalace action. Could be negative number in case of devest.

params.force: - if true rebalaces pool immediately to target value from AM config,        otherwise checks shouldRebalance first.

updateBalanceOfPool(bytes32).details: Is used to update Balancer's vault with amount controlled by AM. E.g. if amount of tokens increased due to compounded investments.

devdoc.title: TetuVaultAssetManager

Rebalance(bytes32).notice: Emitted when asset manager is rebalanced

capitalOut(bytes32,uint256).notice: allows an authorized rebalancer to remove capital to facilitate large withdrawals

getAUM(bytes32).notice: shows amount of tokens under management by this AM (currently invested)

getPoolAddress().notice: return attached pool address for this Asset Manager

getPoolBalances(bytes32).notice: shows amount of tokens in Balancer Vault and controlled by the AM.

getToken().notice: return underlying token which managed by AssetManager

initialize(bytes32).notice: We need to provide AM during pool creation but AM should know the PoolID.   To resolve this cyclic reference we need to have a separate method to store poolId

maxInvestableBalance(bytes32).notice: return amount of underlying token which can be invested by AM according to configuration. After the rebalance expected to be 0 e.g target is 80% and current investment is 60% thus 20% of pool TVL can be invested.

rebalance(bytes32,bool).notice: Rebalances funds between pool and asset manager to maintain target investment percentage.

setConfig(bytes32,bytes).notice: If invested amount is lower than this amount in percents, shouldRebalance returns true.

shouldRebalance(uint256,uint256).notice: Determines whether the pool should rebalance given the provided balances
